data.text:
Had an absolutely amazing Easter long weekend break in Barcelona, and staying in this hotel really made it for us (I had some anxiety after booking as read some reviews) but what made it was the location, room and friendliness of the staff. 

Our room wasn’t ready at approx 12.30 but that’s understandable as checkin not until 3. Cases stored safely and we got checked in still and when we came back at approx 6pm the cases had been taken upto the room (how excellent!) the room was very big clean and I loved how the bathroom (also big) was outside of the bedroom area as was the closet. Also a lovely double bed not two singles pushed together! Also at last a huge glam wall mirror with nothing in front of it! Coffee facilities a fridge and Alexa! Also an Easter treat. 

We went upto the rooftop bar before heading back out and wow wow wow!! This was the icing on the cake for us. It didn’t immediately look like it but lots of stools around the side with views over the city , sagrada familia even! And the Tibidabi church on the very top of the mountain straight in front, at night all lit up! But the best of all were the drinks and the service from Andrea and his team who we got to know. 

We’ve been to many bars all over some lovely rooftops etc but this was the most friendly bar we had been too for a very very long time and it was really appreciated to have been genuinely taken care of. Please take time to speak with the guys they are doing an amazing job and can give lots of great tips on places to go. The reception and front of house were also very good and took us up to see the pool as we couldn’t find it due to some renovations which didnt affect our stay at all. The pool looked amazing but whilst sunny not quite warm enough for a dip yet. So sorry I didn’t have cash to tip the guy that showed us and took care of our cases but he was also amazing and we saw him dashing around out front getting guests cabs. The hotel is in a very nice spot very close to all shops from Gucci to Zara to Primark. Very good tapas restaurants bars nearby the area and surrounding streets are very nice yet so central. Easily walk to metros, open top bus etc etc We very easily got to cable car, using metro, parc guell and sagrada familia. 2 Gaudì houses are just up and around the block. Go to the port and beach for a walk along prom, and gothic quarter and all the small streets. Just so much to do. So sad that before we went and whilst there , many warned us of pick pockets. We didn’t see anything bad, the streets were continually being cleaned and spotless. Like anywhere in the world you have to have your senses about you. We felt the airport lacked direction to the metro and we wasted well over an hour getting to the hotel. Got a cab back to airport took less than 20 mins and approx 23 euros so I wouldn’t waste your time doing the metro from airport. We landed in terminal 2c and it was quite a walk  to the station and very hard to find, the signs were not good and no one around to ask outside. Then we had to change and it wasnt like London a quick change over, so get a cab to and from airport to hotel or we noticed a bus ran outside terminals. 

Back to hotel make sure you say hello to the rooftop bar team they are doing an amazing job and hope they are getting fabulous recognition from NH Hotels as they throughly deserve it! All the best guys hope to be back some day!
data.title: Fab location, clean friendly and best Rooftop bar/service

data.text:
Stayed at the hotel Calderone for three nights. The room was nice and large, we had a great view, and the breakfast was the best of all the hotels in Spain that we stayed at. A great location for seeing the sites in Barcelona.

I took off one star due to the lighting in the room, especially the bathroom. It was very dark in the bathroom. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It was very comfortable and enjoyable.
data.title: Nice hotel!

data.text:
on a high floor, 2 beds and it comes with Culinary amenity upon arrival .
We arrived after over 24 hrs of traveling and after we checked in at the front desk and they collected the deposit they informed me that the room is not ready so we waited and no one came or called to let us know that the room is ready .. we found out 1.5 hr later when I went again to the front desk to check the status!
The high floor was the 3rd floor .. horrible views to a construction site , instead of going to relax after the long flight, we had to hear the construction noise and the construction workers screaming the whole time.
Sheets were so dirty and have holes all over. 
Weed smell in the hallway.
They left a small chocolate as the (Culinary amenity upon arrival) 
I informed the front desk of all the complaints and showed them pictures of dirty sheets. They had me meet with the manager and all she could help with was to separate the beds in the room to have 2 beds or DOWNGRADE my room .
I agreed to separate the beds and refused the downgrade and her offer to give me a voucher for a free drink at one of the restaurants at the hotel to compensate for all the dirty sheets, construction noise and everything else that was going wrong .
Been 3 days and I'm still waiting for the beds to be separated!! Been sleeping on the dirts very uncomfortable pull-out sofa .
Will never book in NH hotel ever again.
data.title: Dirty sheets/ noise

data.text:
Our experience both from the city and the hotel were memorable and really one of the kind. The services from this hotel are exceptional and ones that trully characterize a five stars classificitation. 
First of all the room was spacious and organized to the gratest detail. I was really impressed with the personal Alexa assistance, available in the room and fully equiped to offer us any detail for our stay.
The breakfast was the best and it included everything necessary for us to boost our day and explore the city with great energy. 
The environment and the decoration of the hotel was magical.
And last but not least the staff of the loby, the reception, as well as of the breakfast area, were really kind and available to assist us in any possible way. I would like to especially thank Giorgia, who was really kind to offer us any insight of the city we would ask and even arranged for us a table booking to an amazing restaurant that some friends told us about. Giorgia we really apreciate all of your assistance and we would be happy to see you in Greece.
data.title: A memorable experience
